name: Ability Score
description:
Measures of different abilities: 
* Strength
* Dexterity
* Constitution
* Intelligence
* Wisdom
* Charisma


Max 20 for characters, 30 for monsters/divines. Used to calculate Ability Modifiers. Each has associated Skills, e.g. Strength has Athletics.

name: Attack
description:
* Choose target
* Determine modifiers - eg if target has Cover, if have Advantage/Disadvantage, etc
* Do Attack Roll, and on hit do Damage Roll

name: Attack Roll
description:
Roll d20 + Ability Modifier (Strength for melee weapon, Dexterity for ranged) + Proficiency Bonus (if Proficient with weapon) + Advantage (if they can't see you) - Disadvantage (if you can't see them).
Rolling a 20 is a Critical Hit, 1 is always a miss.

Melee attacks should be within 5 feet. If no weapon can roll with Advantage to do bludgeon damage of 1+Strength Modifier.


Ranged attacks must be within range of weapon - normal vs long range - if long range or within 5ft gives Disadvantage.

name: Class
description: Fighter, Druid, Ranger, etc

name: Combat
description:
Establish physical positions and roll Initiative to determine turn order (including adversaries). Then take turns doing Actions. Each round lasts 6 seconds.
During your turn can move a distance up to your Speed AND take one Action. Can break up movement around action. Difficult terrain or obstructions takes up extra foot per foot moved. Can talk/gesture and interact with one object for free (e.g. drawing sword).

name: Damage Roll
description: Roll dice appropriate for weapon, add Ability Modifier (same as for Attack Roll). If got Critical Hit, roll all damage dice twice, add, then add modifiers.

name: Experience Points (XP)
description: Represent character's experience and determines their Level. Gain for monsters kills, significant actions etc. See table.

name: Hit Dice (HD)
description: These determine how many Hit Points a character has. Different races have different types of hit dice, e.g. d8, d10.

name: Hit Points (HP)
description:
Represents health. At first level, HP = max of Hit Dice + Constitution Modifier (see Ability Score Modifiers). At subsequent levels, roll Hit Dice and add that with Constitution Modifier to obtain new HP. 


When reach 0 or below HP, can be Dead or Unconscious - dead if get Massive Damage (if remaining damage >= HP max). When unconscious must make Saving Throws against death [see p197]

name: Initiative
description: Everyone in Combat (incl monsters) rolls for Initiative at beginning of Combat, which determines the order they take Turns.

name: Level
description: Character Levels are based on Experience Points (XP) - as reach higher levels gain more abilities, skills, spells, etc.

name: Race
description: Human, Elf, Hobbit, etc - determines Hit Dice etc

name: Speed
description: How far can travel in one combat Round (6 seconds) with short bursts of energy. Normal Movement is slower.

name: Ability Check
description: Do to test innate talent/training to overcome a challenge. Difficulty of task is the Difficulty Class (DC), 1-20. Very easy 5, Easy 10, etc.

name: Ability Modifier
description: Based on raw Ability Scores - range from -5 to +10. Ability Modifier = floor((Ability Score - 10) / 2). e.g. if Strength = 13 then Strength Modifier = +1

name: Action
description:
Available actions during Combat include 
* Attack
* Cast Spell
* Dash - move at double speed

* Disengage - avoid Opportunity Attacks
* Dodge - any attack against you has disadvantage if you can see them, and make Dexterity Saving Throws with Advantage
* Help - aid someone and they gain Advantage on next Ability Check you're helping them with. or aid in Attack so they gain Advantage.
* Hide - make Dexterity (Stealth) check to hide
* Ready - lets you act immediately on some trigger before start of your next turn
* Search - make Wisdom (Perception) or Intelligence (Investigation) Check
* Use - if want to use more than one object in your turn
* Other - improvise!

name: Advantage / Disadvantage
description: For Advantage, roll twice and take best score. For Disadvantage take worst.

name: Conditions
description:
Alter capabilities in various ways.

* Blinded
* Charmed
* Deafened
* Exhaustion

Due to starvation etc. Effects are cumulative. Long rests reduce level by 1. 


| Level | Effect                                         |
| ----------- | ----------- ||     1 | Disadvantage on ability checks                 |
|     2 | Speed halved                                   |
|     3 | Disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws |
|     4 | Hit point maximum halved                       |
|     5 | Speed reduced to 0                             |
|     6 | Death                                          |

* Frightened
* Grappled
* Incapacitated
* Invisible
* Paralyzed
* Petrified
* Poisoned
* Prone
* Restrained
* Stunned
* Unconscious

name: Damage Types
description:
Types of Damage include 


* Acid
* Bludgeoning
* Cold
* Fire
* Force - magic
* Lightning
* Necrotic - withers matter and soul
* Piercing - teeth
* Poison
* Psychic
* Radiant - fire/spirit
* Slashing - swords
* Thunder - sound

Can have Resistance to different Damage Types - damage is halved, or Vulnerability - damage is doubled.

name: Difficulty Class (DC)
description: The difficulty of a task from 1 to 20 - used for Ability Checks, Saving Throws. Like Armor Class (AC).

name: Inspiration
description: DM can grant Inspiration when player does something in character, or inspiring. Player can spend it for Advantage on a roll, or give it to another character.

name: Proficiencies
description: Can have Proficiency in different weapons - during Combat can add Proficiency Bonus to Attack Rolls and Damage Rolls.

name: Proficiency Bonus
description: Value added to rolls when player is Proficient in a relevant skill. Based on player's Level - first level is +2.

name: Saving Throw
description: Roll d20 to resist spells, traps, poison, disease etc - Difficulty Class (DC) determined by effect causing it.

name: Searching
description: Use a Wisdom (Perception) Ability Check. Must say specifically where are searching to find hidden things.

name: Skills
description:
Each Ability Score covers a set of Skills you can be Proficient in, and referred to like Strength (Athletics). For Ability Checks can add Proficiency Bonus if a Skill is relevant.

Strength
* Athletics

Dexterity
* Acrobatics
* Sleight of Hand
* Stealth

Intelligence
* Arcana
* History
* Investigation
* Nature
* Religion

Wisdom
* Animal Handling
* Insight
* Medicine
* Perception
* Survival

Charisma
* Deception
* Intimidation
* Performance
* Persuasion

name: Carrying Capacity
description: Amount of weight you can carry - Speed is affected as you carry more.

name: Cover
description: Can hide behind things during Combat. Half Cover gives +2 AC. Three quarters gives +5, and Total Cover can't be attacked except by certain spells.

name: Crafting
description: Can craft adventuring equipment, works of art. Must be Proficient with tools related to object, access to materials. For each day spent crafting can make market value up to 5gp, with cost of half that. e.g. plat armor (1500gp) takes 300 days to craft alone. Others can help.

name: Downtime
description: Between adventures - spend money each day for lifestyle expenses. Can Craft items, eg armor, work at a Profession to earn money, Rest to recover from poisons, do Research to find information, Train to learn new Language or Tool Skill.

name: Exhaustion
description: See Conditions

name: Food / Water
description: Need one pound food and one gallon water/day, two gallons if hot. Below this suffer increasing levels of Exhaustion. [has detailed rules]

name: Hiding
description: aka Stealth - make a Dexterity (Stealth) check when attempting to hide from enemies etc.

name: Passive Checks
description: For hiding, exploration - to check for traps, secrets, etc. No die roll - for score just use 10 + all modifiers relevant to check, with +5 if have Advantage, -5 if Disadvantage.

name: Rest
description:
Short Rests need at least an hour. Can roll Hit Dice n times, where n = your Level number - add that plus your Constitution Modifier each time to your Hit Points. 
Long Rests need at least 8 hours, and restore all Hit Points.
Optionally, both require use of one Healer's Kit first. 

You can use Downtime between adventures to recover from debilitating injury, disease, or poison. After 3 days of downtime can make DC 15 Constitution Saving Throw. On success can gain Advantage on Saving Throws against one disease or poison.

name: Training
description: Can train to learn new Language, Tool Skill Proficiency - must find instructor. Training lasts 250 days and costs 1gp per day.

name: Travel
description: Can travel at normal, fast, or slow pace. [table pg182] Can only do half speed in Difficult Terrain.
